Getting started

Learn how to compile the source code, builds the theme and documentation, and more.

Welcome

Quick start

Download the source and try to apply the precompiled theme (dist/theme.xml) to your blog. Customize and builds the theme and documentation to suit your needs.

Download

Download source

Contents

Once downloaded, you’ll see something like this:

bloggerable
├── dist
│   ├── bundle
│   ├── docs
│   ├── skin
│   └── theme.xml
└── src
    ├── _docs
    ├── _includes
    ├── _js
    ├── _scss
    ├── config.base.json
    ├── config.docs.json
    ├── config.theme.json
    ├── skin.css
    ├── template-skin.css
    └── theme.xml
File / DirectoryDescription
distThe dist folder includes precompiled files. We provide compiled theme (theme.xml), compiled and minified CSS and JS (bundle.css and bundle.js), as well as compiled and minified documentation files.
srcThese are the source code that will be compiled into dist.
src/_docsThe source code for documentation (dist/docs).
src/_includesThe partials that can be mixed and matched by your theme.
The grunt-bake tag:
<!--(bake _includes/file.ext)--> - relative
<!--(bake /_includes/file.ext)--> - absolute
can be used to include the partial in _includes/file.ext.
src/_jsThe source code for JavaScript (dist/bundle/bundle.js).
src/_scssThe source code for CSS (dist/bundle/bundle.css).
src/config.base.json
src/config.docs.json
src/config.theme.json
Stores configuration data.
config.base.json - you can access the data using {{ base.data }}.
config.docs.json - you can access the data using {{ docs.data }}.
config.theme.json - you can access the data using {{ theme.data }}.
src/skin.css
src/template-skin.css
Styles in skin.css are defined within the <b:skin> tag. You can use the skin variables.
Styles in template-skin.css are defined within the <b:template-skin> tag.
src/theme.xmlThe main file for the theme.
Other files/foldersBeyond that, any other included file and directory provides support for packages, license information, and development.

Tooling setup

We uses Grunt for its build system. To use our build system, you’ll need the source files and Node. Follow these steps:

  1. Download and install Node.js, which we use to manage our dependencies.
  2. Install grunt-cli globally with npm install -g grunt-cli.
  3. Navigate to the root /bloggerable directory and run npm install to install our local dependencies listed in package.json.

When completed, you’ll be able to run the various commands provided from the command line.

Using Grunt commands

Our Gruntfile.js includes the following commands and tasks:

TaskDescription
grunt distgrunt dist creates the /dist directory with compiled files.
grunt watchWatches the source files and automatically building them whenever you save.

Local documentation

You can run the documentation locally via Grunt commands:

  1. From the root /bloggerable directory, run grunt docs-serve in the command line.
  2. Open http://localhost:9001 in your browser.
